Comment.value: 10 = Overall campaign objective. Not resolved in this module.

value.0: Wounded in battle, you awoke to find Ahmed, your Prince, impaled before you. With his dying breath, he implored you to "Tell the King that she is dead." So began your journey in the Witch's Wake.
A Message for the King

The BioWare Community Live Team presents:
 
'Neverwinter Nights: Witch's Wake' v0.0
 
Designed & Implemented by:
  Rob Bartel

Credits

Comment.value:
10 = The Ragpicker tells the player to find the Night Hag
20 = Objective Resolved (Enter Hag's Home)

value.0: Mistaking you for yet another corpse upon the bloody battlefield, an old ragpicker woke you as she stole your ring. Aside from the grisly nature of your first meeting, she appeared to harbor you no ill will. In fact, weary of her work, she offered to pay you for anything you could gather from the fallen. The ragpicker also spoke of a creature called the Night Hag who is said to live within the mountain's southeast pass. Though suspicious of any creature that goes by such a name, you admit that you could use her help.

Mistaking you for yet another corpse upon the bloody battlefield, an old ragpicker woke you as she stole your ring. Aside from the grisly nature of your first meeting, she appeared to harbor you no ill will. In fact, weary of her work, she offered to pay you for anything you could gather from the fallen. The ragpicker also spoke of a creature called the Night Hag who is said to live within the mountain's southeast pass. Though suspicious of any creature that goes by such a name, you admit that you could use her help. [Resolved]
In Search of the Night Hag

Comment.value: 10 = Objective Resolved (Player is thrown into mines)

value.0: In your search for the Cavanaugh Stone, you have been mistaken as an accomplice to its theft. The Guild Council of Brogan's Arm has captured you and thrown you into the Steinfaar Iron Mine. Your only solace lies in the fact that at least the man whom you've been seeking is also trapped somewhere in these darkened tunnels. Gathering your courage, you journey on. [Resolved].
Into the Mines

***TOO LONG - DO NOT USE***

The Witch's Wake series supports a wide variety of custom subraces. To designate your character as one of these subraces, restart the module and type the subrace name into your character's subrace field during character creation. Note that the bonuses and penalties outlined below are applied on top of any existing racial modifiers. Also, any skill bonuses require you to gain one point in that skill before the bonus ranks are made available. The subraces for the Witch's Wake series are as follows:

DWARF: CAIRN
   Long exiled from their traditional homelands down below, these hardy, grey-skinned dwarves live in nomadic bands upon the surface, occasionally settling down to form small villages. They get their name from their tradition of interring their dead in rocky cairns so as not to break the terms of their exile. The Barrow Dwarves, followers of Brogan Nachtjager, are considered a heretical offshoot of the Cairn Dwarves.
   Favored Class: Barbarian
   Properties:
      -2 Dex
      +2 Con
      -2 Cha
      +1 AC
      +1 Fortitude Saves
      +1 Reflex Saves
      -1 Will Saves

DWARF: LOREKEEPER
   Buried deep within their mountain fortresses, Lorekeeper Dwarves pursue a solemn life of ascetic monasticism. They value knowledge and awareness above all else, dedicating themselves to the creation, maintainance, and study of vast underground libraries. Many make pilgrimages to the surface world in search of new books and reports of wars and famines in distant lands.
   Favored Class: Wizard
   Properties:
      -2 Str
      +2 Int
      +2 Wis
      +2 Save vs Mind-Affecting Spells
      -1 Fortitude Save
      +4 Lore
      +4 Spellcraft

ELF: NOMAD
   The rugged, pale-eyed Elves known to the world as Nomads are said to never lay their heads in the same place twice. Calling themselves 'The Forgotten Ones' or 'Those Left Behind,' they pace restlessly across the lands in ones or twos, in search of vengeance. Quick to anger and slow to heal, ill talk tends to follow in their wake.
   Favored Class: Fighter
   Properties:
      +2 Str
      -2 Dex
      +2 Con
      -2 Wis
      -2 Cha
      +1 Save vs Disease
      +1 Save vs Death Magic
      +1 Save vs Poison
      75% Immunity to Negative Energy
      50% Vulnerability to Divine Damage
      50% Vulnerability to Positive Energy
      -1 Reflex Save
      Immune to Cure Spells

ELF: SHADOW
   The so-called Elves of the Shadow have come to dominate much of Elven society, especially in its urban centers. Quick-witted and decadent, they play out their countless intriques against each other in the Elven courts, the other races serving as unwitting pawns in their endless gambit for power.
   Favored Class: Rogue
   Properties:
      +2 Int
      -2 Cha
      +1 AC vs Good
      25% Vulnerability to Positive Energy
      10% Immunity to Negative Energy
      Darkvision
      +2 Hide
      +2 Move Silently

ELF: SYLVAN
   Some Elves still linger in the ancient forests, holding fast to the old ways and the teachings of the firstmen. They are few in number, however, and the forests are but a ghost of their former selves. Leaders among the Sylvan Elves claim that the world is ending and that they will be there when it does.
   Favored Class: Ranger
   Properties:
      -2 Int
      +2 Cha
      +2 AC vs Elementals
      50% Vulnerability to Fire
      +4 Animal Empathy
      Tracking

GNOME: DEEP
   Hardly miners in the traditional sense, Deep Gnomes have a raven-like fascination for all things shiny. Though they prize mirrors above all else, they are loathe to part with even the least of their baubles. This has earned them a reputation as sadistic and suspicious tricksters - many a thief has met a painful and embarrassing end trying to steal from a Deep Gnome's treasury.
   Favored Class: Rogue
   Properties:
      +2 Dex
      +2 Wis
      -4 Cha
      +1 AC vs Good
      25% Vulnerability to Positive Energy
      10% Immunity to Negative Energy
      Darkvision
      +2 Hide
      +2 Move Silently

GNOME: TINKER
   Industrious and often obsessed, Tinker Gnomes are renowned crafters. Unlike their more reclusive, subterranean brethren, Tinkers are talkative and outgoing, wandering constantly from town to town in search of new supplies and markets for their often useless creations. Every leap year, they gather for a Grand Crafting, a festive exchange of unsold wares that they can cannibalize for parts over the coming seasons. 
   Favored Class: Wizard
   Properties:
      -2 Con
      +2 Int
      -2 Wis
      +2 Appraise
      +4 Craft Armor
      +4 Craft Weapon
      +4 Craft Trap
      +2 Disarm Trap
      +2 Set Trap
      +2 Open Lock
      +4 Use Magic Device

HALF-ELF: AIR-TOUCHED
   Lithe, graceful and free-willed, it is said the Air-Touched are distant descendents of the firstmen, born only among those of human ancestry. Such births are rare, often skipping many generations, but they are always seen as signs of great import. Some societies treat the Touched with holy reverence while others consider them beasts to be hunted and feared. Whatever the case, they are almost always set apart from the rest of their kith and kin.
   Favored Class: Rogue
   Properties:
      -2 Str
      +2 Dex
      +2 Int
      -2 Wis
      +2 AC vs Law
      10% Immunity to Cold
      10% Immunity to Electricity
      25% Vulnerability to Magical Damage

HALF-ELF: PEREGRINE
   Surrounded by a nimbus of light wherever they go, Peregrines are often considered to be somehow either Angelic in origin or Angelic by nature. All the same, the jails of the land are often full of them, each one imprisoned for some crime of treason or passion or despair. It is said they love too fully, too impulsively, rarely able to see the wider consequences of their actions.
   Favored Class: Paladin
   Properties:
      -2 Con
      -2 Int
      +2 Wis
      +2 Cha
      +2 AC vs Evil
      25% Immunity to Positive Energy
      25% Vulnerability to Negative Energy
      10% Vulnerability to Fire
      Light: Dim (White)

HALF-ELF: NOMAD
   The rugged, pale-eyed Elves known to the world as Nomads are said to never lay their heads in the same place twice. Calling themselves 'The Forgotten Ones' or 'Those Left Behind,' they pace restlessly across the lands in ones or twos in search of vengeance. Quick to anger and slow to heal, ill talk tends to follow in their wake.
   Favored Class: Fighter
   Properties:
      +2 Str
      -2 Dex
      +2 Con
      -2 Wis
      -2 Cha
      +1 Save vs Disease
      +1 Save vs Death Magic
      +1 Save vs Poison
      75% Immunity to Negative Energy
      50% Vulnerability to Divine Damage
      50% Vulnerability to Positive Energy
      -1 Reflex Save
      Immune to Cure Spells

HALF-ELF: SHADOW
   The so-called Elves of the Shadow have come to dominate much of Elven society, especially in its urban centers. Quick-witted and decadent, they play out their countless intriques against each other in the Elven courts, the other races serving as unwitting pawns in their endless gambit for power.
   Favored Class: Wizard
   Properties:
      +2 Int
      -2 Cha
      +1 AC vs Good
      25% Vulnerability to Positive Energy
      10% Immunity to Negative Energy
      Darkvision
      +2 Hide
      +2 Move Silently

HALF-ELF: SYLVAN
   Some Elves still linger in the ancient forests, holding fast to the old ways and the teachings of the firstmen. They are few in number, however, and the forests are but a ghost of their former selves. Leaders among the Sylvan Elves claim that the world is ending and that they will be there when it does.
   Favored Class: Bard
   Properties:
      -2 Int
      +2 Cha
      +2 AC vs Elementals
      50% Vulnerability to Fire
      +4 Animal Empathy
      Tracking

HALF-ELF: TAINTED
   Considered sullen and devious by some, resourceful and far-thinking by others, few seem to agree on the nature and origins of the Tainted. Given the aura of red light that seems to follow them, some argue that they must be devilspawn or agents of Stygia. More rational voices, however, insist that they must be lingering vestiges from the time of the firstmen, much like their elemental brethren, the Touched.
   Favored Class: Wizard
   Properties:
      +1 Str
      -2 Con
      +2 Int
      -2 Cha
      +2 AC vs Good
      25% Immunity to Negative Energy
      25% Vulnerability to Positive Energy
      10% Vulnerability to Cold
      Light: Dim (Red)

HALF-ELF: WATER-TOUCHED
   Mysterious, enduring, and mercurial, it is said the Water-Touched are distant descendents of the firstmen, born only among those of human ancestry. Such births are rare, often skipping many generations, but they are always seen as signs of great import. Some societies treat the Touched with holy reverence while others consider them beasts to be hunted and feared. Whatever the case, they are almost always set apart from the rest of their kith and kin.
   Favored Class: Paladin
   Properties:
      -2 Dex
      +2 Con
      -2 Int
      +2 Cha
      +2 AC vs Chaos
      10% Immunity to Acid
      10% Immunity to Fire
      25% Vulnerability to Cold

HALF-ORC: EARTH-TOUCHED
   Stalwart, loyal, and wise, it is said the Earth-Touched are distant descendents of the firstmen, born only among those of human ancestry. Such births are rare, often skipping many generations, but they are always seen as signs of great import. Some societies treat the Touched with holy reverence while others consider them beasts to be hunted and feared. Whatever the case, they are almost always set apart from the rest of their kith and kin.
   Favored Class: Cleric
   Properties:
      +2 Str
      -2 Dex
      +2 Wis
      -2 Cha
      +2 AC vs Chaos
      10% Immunity to Cold
      10% Immunity to Electricity
      25% Vulnerability to Sonic

HALF-ORC: FIRE-TOUCHED
   Quick, cunning, and arrogant, it is said the Fire-Touched are distant descendents of the firstmen, born only among those of human ancestry. Such births are rare, often skipping many generations, but they are always seen as signs of great import. Some societies treat the Touched with holy reverence while others consider them beasts to be hunted and feared. Whatever the case, they are almost always set apart from the rest of their kith and kin.
   Favored Class: Monk
   Properties:
      +2 Dex
      -2 Con
      +2 Int
      -2 Cha
      +2 AC vs Law
      10% Immunity to Fire
      10% Immunity to Electrical
      25% Vulnerability to Cold

HALF-ORC: PEREGRINE
   Surrounded by a nimbus of light wherever they go, Peregrines are often considered to be somehow either Angelic in origin or Angelic by nature. All the same, the jails of the land are often full of them, each one imprisoned for some crime of treason or passion or despair. It is said they love too fully, too impulsively, rarely able to see the wider consequences of their actions.
   Favored Class: Cleric
   Properties:
      -2 Con
      -2 Int
      +2 Wis
      +2 Cha
      +2 AC vs Evil
      25% Immunity to Positive Energy
      25% Vulnerability to Negative Energy
      10% Vulnerability to Fire
      Light: Dim (White)

HALF-ORC: SOJOURNER
   Abstaining from all worldy concerns, Sojourner Orcs consider themselves pilgrims along their inevitable deathward journey. Though deeply spiritual, they hold to no organized religion, as each Sojourner is left to chart his or her own path. They often integrate weapons training into their meditations and those who enter into battle are veritable juggernaughts, showing little fear of death.
   Favored Class: Fighter
   Properties:
      -4 Dex
      +4 Con
      +1 Save vs Disease
      +1 Save vs Death Magic
      +1 Save vs Poison
      90% Immunity to Negative Energy
      75% Vulnerability to Divine Damage
      75% Vulnerability to Positive Energy
      -2 Natural AC
      Immune to Cure Spells

HALF-ORC: TAINTED
   Considered sullen and devious by some, resourceful and far-thinking by others, few seem to agree on the nature and origins of the Tainted. Given the aura of red light that seems to follow them, some argue that they must be devilspawn or agents of Stygia. More rational voices, however, insist that they must be lingering vestiges from the time of the firstmen, much like their elemental brethren, the Touched.
   Favored Class: Wizard
   Properties:
      +1 Str
      -2 Con
      +2 Int
      -2 Cha
      +2 AC vs Good
      25% Immunity to Negative Energy
      25% Vulnerability to Positive Energy
      10% Vulnerability to Cold
      Light: Dim (Red)

HALFLING: FERAL
   Wild and savage, these forest-dwelling Halflings are fiercely territorial, harassing passing travelers and the Sylvan Elves alike (although steps are being taken towards a uneasy truce with the latter). Though no match for their Imperial brethren in the open field, Feral Halflings have successfully managed to hem in the Empire's western expansion despite numerous campaigns to break them. 
   Favored Class: Druid
   Properties:
      +2 Dex
      -2 Int
      +2 Wis
      -2 Cha
      +2 AC vs Law
      +1 AC vs Neutral
      -1 Natural AC
      10% Immunity to Cold
      10% Immunity to Fire
      10% Vulnerability to Slashing
      Tracking
      +4 Animal Empathy

HALFLING: IMPERIAL
   Halflings' small stature often belies the vastness of their precious Empire and the scope of their ambition. Every Imperial Halfling is trained in the arts of war from childhood and countless crusades against as many enemies have hardened them into a hard and unforgiving people. Disciplined and well-led, they make valued allies and intractable foes. 
   Favored Class: Fighter
   Properties:
      +4 Str
      -4 Dex
      +2 Con
      -2 Int
      -2 Wis
      +2 AC vs Chaos
      +1 AC vs Neutral
      -1 Deflection AC
      Martial Weapon Proficiency
      10% Immunity to Bludgeoning
      10% Immunity to Piercing
      10% Immunity to Slashing
      25% Vulnerability to Magical Damage

Subraces

The Witch's Wake series supports a wide variety of custom subraces. To designate your character as one of these subraces, restart the module and type the subrace name into your character's subrace field during character creation. Note that the bonuses and penalties outlined below are applied on top of any existing racial modifiers. Also, any skill bonuses require you to gain one point in that skill before the bonus ranks are made available. The Dwarven subraces for the Witch's Wake series are as follows:

DWARF: CAIRN
   Long exiled from their traditional homelands down below, these hardy, grey-skinned dwarves live in nomadic bands upon the surface, occasionally settling down to form small villages. They get their name from their tradition of interring their dead in rocky cairns so as not to break the terms of their exile. The Barrow Dwarves, followers of Brogan Nachtjager, are considered a heretical offshoot of the Cairn Dwarves.
   Favored Class: Barbarian
   Properties:
      -2 Dex
      +2 Con
      -2 Cha
      +1 AC
      +1 Fortitude Saves
      +1 Reflex Saves
      -1 Will Saves

DWARF: LOREKEEPER
   Buried deep within their mountain fortresses, Lorekeeper Dwarves pursue a solemn life of ascetic monasticism. They value knowledge and awareness above all else, dedicating themselves to the creation, maintenance, and study of vast underground libraries. Many make pilgrimages to the surface world in search of new books and reports of wars and famines in distant lands.
   Favored Class: Wizard
   Properties:
      -2 Str
      +2 Int
      +2 Wis
      +2 Save vs Mind-Affecting Spells
      -1 Fortitude Save
      +4 Lore
      +4 Spellcraft

HALF-ELF: PEREGRINE
   Surrounded by a nimbus of light wherever they go, Peregrines are often considered to be somehow either Angelic in origin or Angelic by nature. All the same, the jails of the land are often full of them, each one imprisoned for some crime of treason or passion or despair. It is said they love too fully, too impulsively, rarely able to see the wider consequences of their actions.
   Favored Class: Paladin
   Properties:
      -2 Con
      -2 Int
      +2 Wis
      +2 Cha
      +2 AC vs Evil
      25% Immune: Positive Energy
      25% Vulnerable: Negative Energy
      10% Vulnerable: Fire
      Light: Dim (White)

HALF-ELF: NOMAD
   The rugged, pale-eyed Elves known to the world as Nomads are said to never lay their heads in the same place twice. Calling themselves 'The Forgotten Ones' or 'Those Left Behind,' they pace restlessly across the lands in ones or twos in search of vengeance. Quick to anger and slow to heal, ill talk tends to follow in their wake.
   Favored Class: Fighter
   Properties:
      +2 Str
      -2 Dex
      +2 Con
      -2 Wis
      -2 Cha
      +1 Save vs Disease
      +1 Save vs Death Magic
      +1 Save vs Poison
      75% Immune: Negative Energy
      50% Vulnerable: Divine Damage
      50% Vulnerable: Positive Energy
      -1 Reflex Save
      Immune to Cure Spells
Subraces: Half-Elves (1)

The Witch's Wake series supports a wide variety of custom subraces. To designate your character as one of these subraces, restart the module and type the subrace name into your character's subrace field during character creation. Note that the bonuses and penalties outlined below are applied on top of any existing racial modifiers. Also, any skill bonuses require you to gain one point in that skill before the bonus ranks are made available. Some of the Half-Elven subraces for the Witch's Wake series are as follows:

HALF-ELF: SHADOW
   The so-called Elves of the Shadow have come to dominate much of Elven society, especially in its urban centers. Quick-witted and decadent, they play out their countless intrigues against each other in the Elven courts, the other races serving as unwitting pawns in their endless gambit for power.
   Favored Class: Wizard
   Properties:
      +2 Int
      -2 Cha
      +1 AC vs Good
      25% Vulnerable: Positive Energy
      10% Immune: Negative Energy
      Darkvision
      +2 Hide
      +2 Move Silently

HALF-ELF: SYLVAN
   Some Elves still linger in the ancient forests, holding fast to the old ways and the teachings of the firstmen. They are few in number, however, and the forests are but a ghost of their former selves. Leaders among the Sylvan Elves claim that the world is ending and that they will be there when it does.
   Favored Class: Bard
   Properties:
      -2 Int
      +2 Cha
      +2 AC vs Elementals
      50% Vulnerable: Fire
      +4 Animal Empathy
      Tracking
Subraces: Half-Elves (2)

The Witch's Wake series supports a wide variety of custom subraces. To designate your character as one of these subraces, restart the module and type the subrace name into your character's subrace field during character creation. Note that the bonuses and penalties outlined below are applied on top of any existing racial modifiers. Also, any skill bonuses require you to gain one point in that skill before the bonus ranks are made available. Some of the Half-Elven subraces for the Witch's Wake series are as follows:

HALF-ELF: TAINTED
   Considered sullen and devious by some, resourceful and far-thinking by others, few seem to agree on the nature and origins of the Tainted. Given the aura of red light that seems to follow them, some argue that they must be devilspawn or agents of Stygia. More rational voices, however, insist that they must be lingering vestiges from the time of the firstmen, much like their elemental brethren, the Touched.
   Favored Class: Wizard
   Properties:
      +1 Str
      -2 Con
      +2 Int
      -2 Cha
      +2 AC vs Good
      25% Immune: Negative Energy
      25% Vulnerable: Positive Energy
      10% Vulnerable: Cold
      Light: Dim (Red)

HALF-ELF: WATER-TOUCHED
   Mysterious, enduring, and mercurial, it is said the Water-Touched are distant descendents of the firstmen, born only among those of human ancestry. Such births are rare, often skipping many generations, but they are always seen as signs of great import. Some societies treat the Touched with holy reverence while others consider them beasts to be hunted and feared. Whatever the case, they are almost always set apart from the rest of their kith and kin.
   Favored Class: Paladin
   Properties:
      -2 Dex
      +2 Con
      -2 Int
      +2 Cha
      +2 AC vs Chaos
      10% Immune: Acid
      10% Immune: Fire
      25% Vulnerable: Cold
Subraces: Half-Elves (3)

The Witch's Wake series supports a wide variety of custom subraces. To designate your character as one of these subraces, restart the module and type the subrace name into your character's subrace field during character creation. Note that the bonuses and penalties outlined below are applied on top of any existing racial modifiers. Also, any skill bonuses require you to gain one point in that skill before the bonus ranks are made available. The Halfling subraces for the Witch's Wake series are as follows:

HALFLING: FERAL
   Wild and savage, these forest-dwelling Halflings are fiercely territorial, harassing passing travelers and the Sylvan Elves alike (although steps are being taken towards a uneasy truce with the latter). Though no match for their Imperial brethren in the open field, Feral Halflings have successfully managed to hem in the Empire's western expansion despite numerous campaigns to break them. 
   Favored Class: Druid
   Properties:
      +2 Dex
      -2 Int
      +2 Wis
      -2 Cha
      +2 AC vs Law
      +1 AC vs Neutral
      -1 Natural AC
      10% Immune: Cold
      10% Immune: Fire
      10% Vulnerable: Slashing
      Tracking
      +4 Animal Empathy

HALFLING: IMPERIAL
   Halflings' small stature often belies the vastness of their precious Empire and the scope of their ambition. Every Imperial Halfling is trained in the arts of war from childhood and countless crusades against as many enemies have hardened them into a hard and unforgiving people. Disciplined and well-led, they make valued allies and intractable foes. 
   Favored Class: Fighter
   Properties:
      +4 Str
      -4 Dex
      +2 Con
      -2 Int
      -2 Wis
      +2 AC vs Chaos
      +1 AC vs Neutral
      -1 Deflection AC
      Martial Weapon Proficiency
      10% Immune: Bludgeoning
      10% Immune: Piercing
      10% Immune: Slashing
      25% Vulnerable: Magical Damage

HALF-ORC: SOJOURNER
   Abstaining from all worldly concerns, Sojourner Orcs consider themselves pilgrims along their inevitable deathward journey. Though deeply spiritual, they hold to no organized religion, as each Sojourner is left to chart his or her own path. They often integrate weapons training into their meditations and those who enter into battle are veritable juggernauts, showing little fear of death.

Comment.value:
10 = Player refuses Hag's Help. She sends him/her to Brogan's Arm in search of an unnamed man and
        the Cavanaugh Stone.
20 = Player obtains Hag's Help. She sends him/her to Brogan's Arm in search of an unnamed man and
        the Cavanaugh Stone.
30 = Objective Resolved (Enter Mines)

value.0: You have found the Night Hag of whom the Ragpicker spoke but you refused her offers of assistance and protection. Nevertheless, she urged you to make the difficult journey south to a dwarven village called Brogan's Arm. There's someone there who can offer you more answers but she refused to give his name. Instead, the Night Hag instructed you to "Seek the Cavanaugh Stone and you cannot fail to find him."

You have found the Night Hag of whom the Ragpicker spoke and accepted her offers of assistance and protection. After telling your fortune and showing you her small domain within the underworld, she has urged you to make the difficult journey south to a dwarven village called Brogan's Arm. There's someone there who can offer you more answers but she refused to give his name. Instead, the Night Hag instructed you to "Seek the Cavanaugh Stone and you cannot fail to find him."

You have found the Night Hag of whom the Ragpicker spoke. She urged you to make the difficult journey south to a dwarven village called Brogan's Arm. There's someone there who can offer you more answers but she refused to give his name. Instead, the Night Hag instructed you to "Seek the Cavanaugh Stone and you cannot fail to find him." [Resolved]
The Cavanaugh Stone

Comment.value: 10 = Objective Resolved. (Player has spoken with Caldrian and witnessed the ghostly figure's message).

value.0:
At long last, you have found the man you sought: a young elf by the name of Caldrian Ayre. The two of you appear to be all that is left of a company of Witch Hunters who followed Prince Ahmed to this remote corner of the world, in service of the King of Barak'Thule. Caldrian's memory of the events that brought you here is little better than your own, however, and what little facts he clings to are those that he was able to scrawl in chalk on the mine walls as his memory faded. Your hopes plummeted when you witnessed a ghostly figure emerge from the mine's gloom and, in Caldrian's own handwriting, write another message on the wall. "The fields of battle lie in the hearts of men," it read, filling you with despair.

-------------------------------

Congratulations! You have completed "The Fields of Battle," Part I of "The Witch's Wake" by Rob Bartel. To continue on to Part II, "The Witch Hunters," speak with the ghostly figure.
The Fields of Battle

Comment.value:
10 = Nimmermaer tells player of the well.
20 = Objective Resolved (Use well).

value.0: Old Man Nimmermaer, the elderly one-armed scholar of Brogan's Arm, has informed you that the well behind his shop will lead you to the Cavanaugh Stone that you are seeking.
Old Man Nimmermaer, the elderly one-armed scholar of Brogan's Arm, has informed you that the well behind his shop will lead you to the Cavanaugh Stone that you are seeking. [Resolved]
The Old Man's Well

Comment.value:
10 = Player discovers scrawl in Tears Exhibit.
20 = Player translates message.
30 = Objective Resolved (Entering Brogan's Tears)

value.0: You discovered a message, scrawled in chalk, within the Guild Exhibits in Brogan's Arm. The message is written in elven and you have been unable to translate it. Regardless, its location in the exhibit suggests some sort of connection with the warm, foul-smelling waters known as Brogan's Tears.

You discovered a message, scrawled in chalk, within the Guild Exhibits in Brogan's Arm. Written in the elven tongue, it reads "Bryn que Cardis Cavanyl d'ru velm a Llorys Brogue, za'et a llandar que moygre eyr qaddara que maar... If the Cavanaugh Stone gave birth to Brogan's Tears, then to find the mother I must pursue the child."

You discovered a message, scrawled in chalk, within the Guild Exhibits in Brogan's Arm. Written in elven, it seems to suggest that the answers you are seeking are somehow tied to the warm, foul-smelling waters known as Brogan's Tears. [Resolved]
Through Brogan's Tears
